Detailed Description

cvmx_agl_gmx_rx::_udd_skp

AGL_GMX_RX_UDD_SKP = Amount of User-defined data before the start of the L2 data

Notes: (1) The skip bytes are part of the packet and will be sent down the NCB packet interface and will be handled by PKI.

(2) The system can determine if the UDD bytes are included in the FCS check by using the FCSSEL field - if the FCS check is enabled.

(3) Assume that the preamble/sfd is always at the start of the frame - even before UDD bytes. In most cases, there will be no preamble in these cases since it will be MII to MII communication without a PHY involved.

(4) We can still do address filtering and control packet filtering is the user desires.

(5) UDD_SKP must be 0 in half-duplex operation unless AGL_GMX_RX_FRM_CTL[PRE_CHK] is clear. If AGL_GMX_RX_FRM_CTL[PRE_CHK] is set, then UDD_SKP will normally be 8.

(6) In all cases, the UDD bytes will be sent down the packet interface as part of the packet. The UDD bytes are never stripped from the actual packet.

(7) If LEN != 0, then AGL_GMX_RX_FRM_CHK[LENERR] will be disabled and AGL_GMX_RX_INT_REG[LENERR] will be zero

Additionally reset when MIX<prt>_CTL[RESET] is set to 1.
